Name: Diaper changing accommodations.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to diaper changing accommodations

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: This bill was not signed at this hearing; a future bill signing ceremony may be announced.

History.Description: This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: Int. No. 1241-A was signed by the Mayor in a bill-signing ceremony held in the City Hall rotunda.

History.Description: This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Summary: This bill would require that new or renovated buildings that contain places of public accommodation include diaper changing tables that are accessible to persons regardless of their gender.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Section BC 1109 of the New York city building code is amended by adding a new section 1109.2.4 to read as follows:
1109.2.4 Diaper changing accommodations.  In assembly group A occupancies and mercantile group M occupancies on each floor level containing a public toilet room, both male and female occupants shall have access to at least one safe, sanitary and convenient diaper changing station, deck, table or similar amenity, which shall comply with Section 603.5 (Diaper Changing Tables) of ICC A117.1. 

      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect 180 days after it becomes law, except that the commissioner of buildings may promulgate rules or take other actions for the implementation of this local law prior to such effective date.


KS/ACK/MPC
LS #2085, 2086, 6127 and 7366
11/27/17 3:25pm

      2
